citations.narrative:
Approximately 1/3 of the outdoor paddock (measuring about 100 feet by 100 feet) where 16 cattle are housed is covered
in standing water and thick mud that is in parts turning green indicating algae growth. The water is due to excessive wet
weather in the area over the past few weeks. The animals have dry pathways to access food, water and shelter. Some of
the animals are standing in the mud and have wet hooves. The facility has employed some mitigation techniques such as
the use of a water pump. Lack of adequate drainage can lead to slip and fall injuries, development of veterinary care
issues, spread of disease, odors and attract pests. A suitable method of drainage shall be provided to rapidly eliminate
excess water. The method of drainage shall comply with applicable Federal, State, and local laws and regulations relating
to pollution control or the protection of the environment.
Correct by 31 December 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the IACUC representative.
n

narrative:
3.127(c) 
   
Facilities, outdoor. 
Approximately 1/3 of the outdoor paddock (measuring about 100 feet by 100 feet) where 16 cattle are housed is covered 
in standing water and thick mud that is in parts turning green indicating algae growth. The water is due to excessive wet 
weather in the area over the past few weeks. The animals have dry pathways to access food, water and shelter. Some of 
the animals are standing in the mud and have wet hooves. The facility has employed some mitigation techniques such as 
the use of a water pump. Lack of adequate drainage can lead to slip and fall injuries, development of veterinary care 
issues, spread of disease, odors and attract pests. A suitable method of drainage shall be provided to rapidly eliminate 
excess water. The method of drainage shall comply with applicable Federal, State, and local laws and regulations relating 
to pollution control or the protection of the environment.  
 
Correct by 31 December 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the IACUC representative.
